title: SQL injection in partner id field on https://www.teavana.com (Sign-up form)

profile.name: Starbucks
profile.about: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit -- one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time.

vulnerability_information:
While signing up for "teavana" shopping account on it came to notice that the partner id validation fails and exists SQL injection.

So this is what I did:

1) Visit https://www.teavana.com/us/en/account
2) Click on signin > create shopping account
3) In the partnerno, gave an input of "1234" (1.PNG)
     Result :No issue as expected . Signup fails
     message: "We are unable to verify starbucks partner id" (2 .PNG)
4) Changed input to "1234' OR 1=1" (without double qoutes) (3.PNG)
    Result: This time signup succeeds!!! (4.PNG)
vulnerability_information_html:
While signing up for "teavana" shopping account on it came to notice that the partner id validation fails and exists SQL injection.

So this is what I did:

1) Visit https://www.teavana.com/us/en/account
2) Click on signin > create shopping account
3) In the partnerno, gave an input of "1234" (1.PNG)
Result :No issue as expected . Signup fails
message: "We are unable to verify starbucks partner id" (2 .PNG)
4) Changed input to "1234' OR 1=1" (without double qoutes) (3.PNG)
Result: This time signup succeeds!!! (4.PNG)

activities.message:
Hello @bigbug, thanks for your report! We need some more information before we can properly review this report. I attempted to enter my partner ID to `1234 OR 1=1` as shown in the POST request below, but the page still states that the partner ID is invalid. Could you provide a video demonstrating the SQL injection?  Thanks again for your report and we hope to hear back from you soon.

{F222313}
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @bigbug, thanks for your report! We need some more information before we can properly review this report. I attempted to enter my partner ID to 1234 OR 1=1 as shown in the POST request below, but the page still states that the partner ID is invalid. Could you provide a video demonstrating the SQL injection? Thanks again for your report and we hope to hear back from you soon.

{F222313}

activities.message:
Hello @coffecup I retried and came to know whats the catch here.

U tried to change the partner id in an already created account using "change status" option, which did not work.

I demonstrated a "fresh signup" and not a profile change case. I would like you to try the same , by creating a new account altogether and not make changes into already made account. In this case it fails to verify and the check is bypassed. Please try this!

Hope this helps.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @coffecup I retried and came to know whats the catch here.

U tried to change the partner id in an already created account using "change status" option, which did not work.

I demonstrated a "fresh signup" and not a profile change case. I would like you to try the same , by creating a new account altogether and not make changes into already made account. In this case it fails to verify and the check is bypassed. Please try this!

Hope this helps.

@coffeecup The partner id verification is bypassed at signup (https://www.teavana.com/us/en/account?dwcont=XXXXXXXXX), but it is checked when changes are being made to already existing account (https://www.teavana.com/on/demandware.store/Sites-Teavana-Site/default/MyAccount-EditProfileAjax)

I guess file that is verifying is not the same for both cases, and so it happens that one gets caught and the other passes through. This is clear from requests being sent to different locations, in above cases.

So I think the issue lies in the code that verifies value at signup (https://www.teavana.com/us/en/account)

Hi @bigbug - Even on the create account page I'm unable to enter `1234 OR 1=1` as a partner number and have it validate. Could you please show a video demonstrating how you're able to do so? It would be very appreciated so I can reproduce this. Thanks! 

{F223938}

activities.message: @coffeecup Sure! I will be sending you the video demonstration shortly.
activities.markdown_message: @coffeecup Sure! I will be sending you the video demonstration shortly.

activities.message: @coffeecup I am sending you the video demonstrating the above scenario as asked. While we enter the value 1234' OR 1=1 directly into the form it is converted as 123%27+OR+11. So a web debugging proxy was used to modify the request. (Charles proxy in this case)  Sorry for the video quality. Had to compress it, due to large-sized file upload difficulties.
activities.markdown_message: @coffeecup I am sending you the video demonstrating the above scenario as asked. While we enter the value 1234' OR 1=1 directly into the form it is converted as 123%27+OR+11. So a web debugging proxy was used to modify the request. (Charles proxy in this case) Sorry for the video quality. Had to compress it, due to large-sized file upload difficulties.

activities.message:
Hello @overice,

I noticed a little unusual behaviour and so decided to add it here. 

While trying to enter  teavana or starbucks card on "My Account page", I noticed that if you enter 
card number as 1111111111111111' OR 1=1 and card pin as 1111111' OR 1=1 you are redirected to https://www.teavana.com/us/en/account-login

I chose to mention this because this differs from the normal behaviour of displaying an error message -
 "The following information was invalid: Card Number and PIN combination", when an incorrect combination is fed as input to https://www.teavana.com/on/demandware.store/Sites-Teavana-Site/default/MyAccount-StarbucksCardAdd?format=ajax. It is clear from the url that it is an ajax request so the error message is displayed.

But if we supply inputs with appended SQL payload it behaves differently by redirecting the user to https://www.teavana.com/us/en/account-login. As user is authenticated, he is taken to my account page. However ***No card is added though. No negative impacts is visible*** 

This may be just an unusual behaviour or a desired one, with no negative impacts. But i thought this should be brought to your notice.

This may be just an unusual behaviour or a desired one, with no negative impacts. But i thought this should be brought to your notice.

Hi @overice, 

Upon trying to check if the bug still exists, I found this message on the teavana site:
**TEAVANA.COM HAS CLOSED**

Hence I couldn't verify the state of the bug. Could you provide any updates on the progress?

How do you plan to proceed with this, as the site no longer has the **create account** link?

Please update!

Thank you

activities.message:
Hi @bigbug -

You are not able to create a new account, however, you can login with your old account and attempt to validate. I just attempted to repro and it is not reproducing. I am going to go ahead and close this out as resolved, however, if you are still able to reproduce please let us know!

Thanks, 
@overice

activities.message:
Hi @overice,

If you notice, as the title suggests the issue was in the **signup** event _only_. If you tried to inject the value on an already existing account by logging in, this wouldn't work, even at the time of submitting this report.  If you notice [activity-2007942](https://hackerone.com/reports/269279#activity-2007942), I had mentioned about this already. 

So the issue existed in the signup/account creation link only. But now as it no more exists, in this case how would this be verified? Could this still be considered as resolved?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @overice,

If you notice, as the title suggests the issue was in the signup event only. If you tried to inject the value on an already existing account by logging in, this wouldn't work, even at the time of submitting this report. If you notice activity-2007942, I had mentioned about this already.

So the issue existed in the signup/account creation link only. But now as it no more exists, in this case how would this be verified? Could this still be considered as resolved?

activities.message:
Hi @bigbug - 

My apologies, you are correct. This was only reproducing in the sign up field and because that feature has been deprecated entirely, we can consider this resolved. This is eligible for public disclosure! 

Thank you for your patience while we worked through your report and we are looking forward to working with you in the near future again!

Best, 
@overice
activities.markdown_message:
